page.title: 10 Celtic Park
page.content: Celtic Park, with a reduced capacity of 67,000 since 1978 when it was 75,000, is situated west of Janefield Street, and east of London Road.Every week, thousands of fans flock to football games there, averaging out at around 22,000, to watch a team drawn from 31 full time professionals, 4 part-time professionals and 18 schoolboy signings.Ground improvements are now taking place.Namely, toilet improvements, new turnstiles and exits.A major improvement is the introduction of under-soil heating and a proposed covering of the west end terracing. In May 1985 Celtic won the 100th Scottish Cup final, at Hampden Park, beating Dundee Utd 2-1.The biggest attendance of this season was 49,000 in a European tie against Rapid Vienna of Austria.
